messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re:Azores
messages.msgSnippet: My Mom s people are from Sao Miguel. I don t think it was genocide as much as assimilation. And then change the history type of thing. I d like to continue
messages.messageBody:
My Mom's people are from Sao Miguel.
I don't think it was genocide as much as assimilation.
And then change the history type of thing.
I'd like to continue this thread - as I have much info - perhaps off-list?
Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: KathrynJB@...
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, September 28, 2003 2:47 PM
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re:Azores


In a message dated 9/27/2003 10:32:53 PM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:

> wow, somebody mentioned the Azores! albeit in the context of a
> possible genocide coverup... which i have never heard anything about,
> but then i am apparently a lot younger than you &maybe embarassing
> history has been revised out since then? i lived there a little over
> a decade ago &my grandfather was Azorean, but he has been dead for 15
> years now &i don't think there is anyone to ask.
> kimberleigh
> *so proud of my heritage that i have the galo de barcelos tattooed on
> my arm!*
>

I'm another one! Both of my paternal grandparents were from the Azores: Sao
Miguel and Sao Maria.

Kathryn
